summary:
Global public health professional with experience in health policy, research, evaluation and project management. Diplomatic communicator and strategic thinker with proven capacity to advance complex strategic and operational projects across institutions. Results-driven, collaborative and adaptive leader with demonstrated ability to build strong stakeholder relationships and partnerships, and manage projects from conceptualization through implementation and evaluation. Strong, adaptive team player that thrives under pressure and in fast-paced environments.

Passionate about improving the quality of, and equitable access to, health care for patients internationally, with a particular focus on mental health. Strong interest in strategies that leverage the power of technology and innovation as a means of responding to complex, multisectoral issues affecting vulnerable populations. Experience in a wide range of health issues, across government, academic, not-for-profit and multilateral sectors.

Native French and English speaker with basic proficiency in Spanish and German.

projects.title: eSalud Pública y Equidad en América Latina y el Caribe, eSAC
projects.description:
El objetivo de eSAC es contribuir a la mejora de la salud y el bienestar de los grupos marginados de la población de la región, para avanzar hacia la equidad en salud a través del desarrollo y aplicación de soluciones en tecnologías de la información y las comunicaciones (TIC) basadas en la salud pública.

eSAC busca estimular los investigadores, a los tomadores de decisiones, profesionales, empresarios, innovadores, a los medios de comunicación y al público en general “a pensar más allá” de las soluciones tradicionales de salud en línea, con un enfoque a nivel individual, mediante la exploración del uso de las TIC en la salud pública con el ánimo de influir en los determinantes sociales de la salud.

profile_positions.description: FRL Consulting supports mission-driven for-profit companies and organizations, including not-for-profits, charitable foundations, multilateral organizations and start-ups to build strategic partnerships, enhance their visibility and maximize their impact. We offer comprehensive, end-to-end services aimed at delivering sustainable and impactful results. Areas of expertise include strategic partnerships and positioning, government relations and political engagement, policy and advocacy, organizational strategy and effectiveness, facilitation and consensus building.
profile_positions.title: Founder & Principal

profile_positions.description:
•	Managed a portfolio of life sciences/pharmaceutical sector clients, including client engagement, leading cross-company teams to execute on client projects, building and managing cross-industry coalitions (e.g., generics, biotechnology, large R&D and diagnostics companies) and multi-stakeholder alliances across health topic areas (e.g., mental and brain health, health technology, AMR, tuberculosis, malaria).
•	Developed and executed strategies, partnerships and client engagement work plans in the areas of public health policy and political advocacy, strategic positioning and communication, ally and narrative building, and issues management. 
•	Supported business development including leading pitches, cultivating new business opportunities, negotiating contracts, brand building and new service offerings.
profile_positions.title: Director

profile_positions.description:
•	Provided technical support to countries, especially low- and middle-income countries, in strengthening policy, service planning and delivery, and health information system strengthening for dementia. This includes organizing and facilitating workshops at country and regional levels.
•	Developed tools and resources to support the implementation of WHO’s Global Action Plan on the Public Health Response to Dementia 2017-2025 in collaboration with global partners and stakeholders, including in the area of policy, inclusive societies and human rights, and carer support.
•	Managed the implementation of WHO’s Global Dementia Observatory, a data and knowledge exchange platform aimed at strengthening countries’ policies, service planning and health and social care systems for dementia.
•	Drafted decision notes and progress reports for WHO's Executive Board meetings and the World Health Assembly, and developing surveys, communication materials and other documentation as required to support WHO’s Global Action Plan on the Public Health Response to Dementia 2017-2025.
profile_positions.title: Consultant, Mental Health and Susbstance Use Department

profile_positions.description:
•	Developed government, donor and global health stakeholder engagement strategies. 
•	Engaged governments, donors and global health stakeholders to identify partnership opportunities and enhance organizational sustainability.
•	Provided strategic advice to the Director of Strategy on issues related to government engagement and organization effectiveness.
•	Represented the organization in global health meetings organized by global health donors and partners.
profile_positions.title: Manager, Government Relations

company.name: Ontario Ministry of Health and Long-Term Care

profile_positions.description:
• Managed the Ministry’s health system/services research portfolio of over $CAD35M in annual investments.
• Led a team of 10 staff in overseeing the Ministry’s Health System Research Fund (HSRF), including stakeholder management, financial oversight, risk and performance measurement, human resource and employee relation management.
• Developed and implemented strategies to enhance team performance and effectiveness resulting in the production of high quality deliverables, productivity gains, and enhanced team cohesiveness.
• Provided strategic advice to the Director and Assistant Deputy Minister on issues related to Ontario’s health research investments.
• Represented the branch, division and/or Ministry in working groups and meetings.
• Led the development of a Cabinet Submission including proposed legislative changes by leading a team of inter-sectoral staff and managers, advising senior management and identifying strategic alignments.
profile_positions.title: Manager (Acting)

profile_positions.description:
• Led an inter-ministerial initiative to enhance evidence-based decision-making and policy development, including leading inter-sectoral staff to deliver high-quality results, setting priorities and goals, establishing roles and responsibilities, and consulting with provincial, national/international stakeholders.
• Led the development of a Cabinet Submission in collaboration with partner ministries, including conducting internal/external consultations, developing briefing materials, securing support across government, and briefing management/senior management (incl. Assistant Deputy and Associate Deputy Ministers).
• Led inter-ministerial working groups and a directors’ steering committee by chairing meetings, establishing agendas, presenting deliverables, incorporating feedback, and following-up on action items.
profile_positions.title: Strategic Project Lead

profile_positions.description:
•	Developed and implemented performance measurement and evaluation frameworks in consultation with internal stakeholders, including the selection of evaluation designs, tools, and indicators to assess strategic health policy/program outcomes.
•	Managed health research investment portfolios (over $CAD 2M), including contract negotiations, stakeholder management, and financial oversight.
•	Developed and implemented an impact assessment framework and performance measurement tools to systematically evaluate how ministry-funded research outcomes inform policy and program development, resulting in a conference presentation.
profile_positions.title: Senior Policy Advisor

profile_positions.description:
•	Led the development and implementation of an impact assessment framework to measure the outcomes and impact of the Health System Research Fund's investments on health policy and practice
•	Managed health research investment portfolios (over $CAD 2M), including negotiations of transfer payment accountability agreements, stakeholder management, and financial oversight.
•	Led the conceptualization and implementation of the Health System Research Fund's Knowledge Translation and Exchange Strategy.
•	Developed monitoring mechanisms to report on strategic knowledge translation initiatives. 
•	Provided research and policy advice to management and senior management for the analysis of issues affecting health research policies and programs, strategic planning and health system design.
profile_positions.title: Research/Planning Analyst

company.name: Centre for Global eHealth Innovation, Toronto General Hospital

profile_positions.company: Centre for Global eHealth Innovation, Toronto General Hospital
profile_positions.description:
•	Coordinated a multidisciplinary, inter-organizational and cross-regional team to develop and implement the work plan in partnership with the Pan-American Health Organization (PAHO).
•	Led the development and implementation of knowledge management policies and mechanisms. 
•	Managed project administration, budgeting, technical coordination, and team support.
•	Contributed to the project’s strategic direction in collaboration with Pan-American Health Organization’s (PAHO) team members.
•      Identified, synthesized and developed content for the project’s online platform.
•      Consulted and collaborated with the IT consultant to ensure ongoing platform maintenance and security.
profile_positions.title: Project Administrator and Knowledge Management Associate

profile_positions.description:
•	Led the planning, design, facilitation, and evaluation of a series of anti-stigma workshops in collaboration with three Community Health Centers (CHCs) in Toronto.
•	Analyzed and reported on evaluation findings to assess the impact of anti-stigma workshops on community health care professionals.
•	Provided policy direction to improve the application of academic research papers resulting in publication.
profile_positions.title: Consultant, Office of Transformative Global Health

profile_positions.description:
•	Researched, synthesized and analyzed Aboriginal health issues and interventions to inform a feasibility study.
•	Conducted key informant interviews and implemented a stakeholder survey to inform a feasibility study.
•	Developed a report of summarizing interview and survey results to inform the work of the consultant team.
•	Liaised with senior staff and the consultant team to incorporate new data into relevant literature reviews.
profile_positions.title: Aboriginal Health Research Assistant

profile_positions.description:
•	Assessed healthcare service delivery and innovation models to improve the organization’s impact on global mental health policy and provide recommendations for strategic planning.
•	Developed a consultant policy report to inform the organization's strategic planning and scale-up mental healthcare delivery models internationally.
profile_positions.title: Consultant

profile_positions.description:
East Africa, Horn of Africa & Sudan Department
•	Produced risk analyses and community-based conflict/post-conflict resolution options for Sudan/South Sudan aimed at the European disbursement of foreign aid and the consolidation of German foreign policy initiatives.
•	Drafted and produced speech documents and country position papers used by the German Foreign Minister in Berlin and in United Nations (UN) consultations in New York.
•	Consulted with various levels of government and civil society to evaluate future policy routes and ensure stakeholder participation and policy sustainability.
profile_positions.title: Policy Intern

volunteer_experiences.description: •	Reviewed and recommended article submissions to maintain quality publication standards
•	Researched and summarized findings on health technology, policy and treatment to disseminate social information and help improve health program development in Malawi.
